results.title: Here comes Mr. Jordan
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Everett Riskin and Alexander Hall
results.brief_description: Joe Pendleton (Robert Montgomery), is a contender for the light heavyweight boxing crown, but is killed in a plane crash. An angel (Edward Everett Horton), realising the error that Joe has arrived in heaven 50 years too early. Trying to rectify the mistake, Mr. Jordon (Claude Rains), the chief deispatcher of the “Heavenly Express” sends Joe back to earth in the body of a just-murdered millionaire. This delightful romantic comedy was so successful, it inspired a musical sequel, “Down to Earth” and was remade as “Heaven can wait” in 1978.

results.title: Herbie rides again
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Walsh and Robert Stevenson
results.brief_description: Another adventure with the VW with a mind of its own; Herbie. In this escapade Herbie comes to the assistance of a little old lady. They combine their efforts to stop a tycoon from building the world’s highest building on her property. Starring Helen Hayes, Ken Berry, Stefanie Powers, John McIntire and Keenan Wynn. Based on a story by Gordon Buford, screenplay by Bill Walsh.

results.title: Henry V
results.creator_credit: BBC, Cedric Messina and David Giles
results.brief_description: Shortly after his coronation, Henry V decided to press his claims to the French throne and leads an army into France. He defeats a vastly larger French army at Agincourt (1415), wins the hand of the French Princess Catherine of Valois, and is recognised as the heir to the French throne.

results.title: Henry & June
results.creator_credit: Walrus and Associates, Peter Kaufman and Philip Kaufman
results.brief_description: Based on the long-suppressed sections of Anais Nin’s diaries “Henry & June” explores the erotic life of two individuals who became 20th Century literary giants. Upon meeting unconvential American author Henry Miller (Fred Ward) in Paris, 1931, Anais Nin (Maria de Medeiros) boldly embarks on a passionate voyage of self-discovery. In their defiant search for new truths, Anais and Henry are tantalized by Henry’s enigmatic and hauntingly sensual wife, June (Uma Thurman)

results.title: Hello, Dolly!
results.creator_credit: Chenault, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Ernest Lehman and Gene Kelly
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand is a knockout as Dolly Levi, the woman “who arranges things… like furniture and daffodils and lives”. The plot concerns Dolly, a young widow and professional matchmaker, who sets her sights and whatever else she can muster, on conquering tight-fisted Yonkers merchant, Horace Vandergelder, beautifully played by Walter Matthau. Spend a magical evening with the incomparabale Barbra and enjoy a great musical. Co-starring Michael Crawford.

results.title: Hello Dolly (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Chenault, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Ernest Lehman and Gene Kelly
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand is a knockout as Dolly Levi, the woman “who arranges things… like furniture and daffodils and lives”. The plot concerns Dolly, a young widow and professional matchmaker who sets her sights and whatever else she can muster, on conquering tight-fisted Yonkers merchant, Horace Vandergelder, beautifully played by Walter Matthau. How she does it has to be the grandest musical there ever was! So, spend a magical evening with the incomparable Barbra and enjoy a great musicals. Also stars Michael Crawford.

results.title: Hedwig and the angry inch
results.creator_credit: Killer Films, New Line Cinema, Pamela Koffler, Katie Roumel, Christine Vachon and John Cameron Mitchell
results.brief_description: Written, directed and starring John Cameron Mitchell, and based on his award-winning Off-Broadway musical, “Hedwig and the Angry Inch” is a startling and moving musical about difference and love. Hedwig started life as a boy in East Germany but when he falls in love with an American GI, he makes the ultimate sacrifice, by cutting off his genitalia to an “angry inch”. Unfortunately, all the GI offers Hedwig back in the USA is life in a trailer park. Hedwig uses his ample imagination to write songs but credit for them is taken by his nemesis (and one true love), Tommy Gnosis (Michael Pitt II). While Hedwig is forced to tour second-rate restaurants and night clubs, Tommy Gnosis has become a huge star. Hedwig won’t rest till Tommy acknowledges both his love and his debt. Featuring an electrifying performance by Mitchell in the title role, and a wonderful set of songs which manage to pay homage to both punk and old theatrical musicals, “Hedwig and the Angry Inch” is a defiant celebration of independence and gender confusion. Made on a miniscule budget, the film boasts inventive art direction and design. Mitchell’s perseverance and courage has paid off. The film has won numerous international film awards including a special prize at the Berlin Film Festival 2001 and the Audience Award and the Best Director Award at the Sundance Film Festival, 2001.

results.title: Heavy traffic
results.creator_credit: Film Creations, Steve Krantz and Ralph Bakshi
results.brief_description: Where’s it all going and where does it lead us? What is life all about? Michael, a struggling cartoonist living with his part Italian part Jewish parents is searching for artistic inspiration in the seedy environment around him - a violent, sexually perverse and polluted one. Reclusive and introspective, Michael makes an unsuccessful pitch to get his work off the ground and is forced into numerous disastrous encounters with prostitutes by friends in an attempt to prove his manhood. It’s barkeep Carole who earns his affections however as well as introducing him to a life of crime. Beginning and ending with live action, Bakshi’s film following “Fritz the cat” (1972) is mainly animated in its portrayal of a seedy, disturbing, yet artistically rich milieu of New York City circa 1970s. Cast includes: Joseph Kaufmann, Beverly Hope Atkinson, Frank DeKova, Terri Haven.

results.title: Heavenly creatures
results.creator_credit: Wingnut Films, Jim Booth and Peter Jackson
results.brief_description: Set in the 1950’s in New Zealand, this film is based on a true story that shocked the nation at the time. New arrival Juliet Hulme (Kate Winslet) quickly befriends the quiet Pauline Parker (Melanie Lynskey) at their conservative school in Christchurch. Although their backgrounds are very different, the two girls are both creative and intelligent writers, and form a close friendship which gradually becomes more and more obsessive. Together, they create a fantasy world peopled by characters who become very real for both of them. Their parents are increasingly disturbed by the obsessive nature of their relationship, and take steps to separate them. This leads to the girls plotting a horrendous crime to ensure they remain together.

results.title: Heaven can wait
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Warren Beatty and Buck Henry
results.brief_description: At a peak in his career LA Rams quarterback Joe Pendleton (Warren Beatty) is erroneously summoned to heaven by an over-zealous escort (co-director Buck Henry). Mr Jordan, a senior official in heaven, (James Mason) seeks to set things in order by offering Joe a place back on earth in the body of another mortal. After seeing environmental lobbyist Betty Logan (Julie Christie) Joe decides to inhabit the body of Leo Farnsworth, a rich amoral industrialist who is in danger from his murderous wife (Dyan Cannon) and her lover (Charles Grodin). When Joe decides to get Pendleton’s body into shape he engages the services of his old coach in order to do so. This comedy was Warren Beatty’s directorial debut and he has great fun as Pendleton/Farnsworth. A fairly light romantic comedy/fantasy, “Heaven can wait” is a remake of “Here comes Mr Jordan” (1941) and was a big hit in 1978. Winner of one Academy Award in 1979 for Best art direction, the film was nominated for seven others.
